com.topcoder.util.log
Interface LogFactory

All Known Implementing Classes:
BasicLogFactory, Jdk14LogFactory, Log4jLogFactory
public interface LogFactory

This interface defines the contract for implementations that will produce Log instances.

The LogFactory will implement the createLog method that takes the name to assign to the Log and return a Log instance for it.

Changes for v2.0: This is a new interface.

The implementations of this interface are either created by the application or by the LogManager directly. The LogManager will then store the implementation in a field and call the createLog method when a Log is needed.

Thread Safety: Implementations of this interface should be thread safe.

Version:
2.0
Author:
Pops, TCSDEVELOPER

Method Summary
 Log createLog(java.lang.String name)
           Creates a Log implementation and assigning the name to it.
 

Method Detail

createLog

public Log createLog(java.lang.String name)
              throws LogException

Creates a Log implementation and assigning the name to it.

Implementors should create a Log implementation to log to the underlying logger system given the name of the logger. If an exception is encountered creating the Log implementation, a LogException should be thrown.

Parameters:
name - A possibly null, possibly empty (trim'd) string representing the name assigned to the log
Returns:
A non-null Log implementation
Throws:
LogException - if an exception occurs creating the log
